author: James Titcomb
title: Google to remove antisemitic answer to 'Who Runs Hollywood' search query
text:
Google to remove antisemitic answer to 'Who Runs Hollywood' search query Company pledges to remove result after asking search engine results in the answer 'Jews' The search term is one of a number that have generated an unwanted response Follow 
Google has promised to remove a search result that gave an antisemitic answer after asking the search engine "Who Runs Hollywood" . 
Putting the query into Google results in a information box giving the answer "Jews". The box quotes from an online article from the New Observer, a website that claims to present "unique news" and "unique views" and includes terms such as "third world colonisers" in its editorial policy. It claims to "present current affairs without the spin of the controlled media". 
The information boxes that exist on Google's search results are designed to give users easily-digestable immediate answers. Asking "How does Ebola spread", for example, results in a box that takes its information from the World Health Organisation website. 
How the search result appears 
These boxes are not curated by humans, but by Google's search algorithm, which (at present) is unable to determine when content is offensive. This means that occasionally, especially for subjects related to conspiracy theories, it gets such answers wrong. 
Asking Google "What happened to the dinosaurs" once yielded a creationist answer . Google's artificial intelligence has generated other controversies.
